key_insight: Vision Mamba uses hybrid selective scanning with multi-head selective state-space models to deliver MRI super-resolution that preserves anatomical fidelity while dramatically reducing computational cost.
problem_solved: Bridges the fidelity–efficiency gap in deep learning MRI super-resolution so high-quality, diagnostically useful upsampling can run with lower latency and resource use for clinical integration.
method: Hybrid selective scanning: adaptively allocate high-resolution processing to clinically important regions while scanning other areas more coarsely to cut computation.
Multi-Head Selective State-Space Models (MHSSM): efficient sequence-modeling blocks that capture long-range spatial context with low FLOPs compared to dense transformers/convolutions.
Lightweight vision backbone ("Vision Mamba"): integrates selective scanning and MHSSM for end-to-end SR with improved fidelity-efficiency trade-offs.
impact: Enables practical deployment of MRI super-resolution in resource-constrained clinical settings and research workflows by lowering compute and latency without sacrificing diagnostic detail, informing design of efficient medical imaging models.
visual_elements: Architecture diagram: block flow showing selective scanning mask → MHSSM blocks → reconstruction head
Before/after MRI slices: paired low-res input, super-res output, and ground truth to highlight preserved anatomy
Compute vs fidelity chart: FLOPs/latency on x-axis and image quality (PSNR/SSIM) on y-axis comparing Vision Mamba to baselines
Selective scanning overlay: heatmap on an MR slice showing where high-resolution attention/processing is focused
paper_title: Efficient Vision Mamba for MRI Super-Resolution via Hybrid Selective Scanning
paper_authors: Mojtaba Safari, Shansong Wang, Vanessa L Wildman, Mingzhe Hu, Zach Eidex
